term.title: isotopically deficient

item.text: An isotopically labelled compound may be designated as isotopically deficient when the isotopic content of one or more elements has been depleted, i.e. when one or more nuclide(s) is (are) present in less than a natural ratio.

sources.item: PAC, 1981, 53, 1887. 'Nomenclature of inorganic chemistry: II.1 - Isotopically modified compounds' on page 1896 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac198153101887)

term.citation: Citation: 'isotopically deficient' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.I03334

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
